alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Mason; Putnam; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 6:02PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Boyd, southeastern Gallia, southeastern Lawrence, southwestern Mason, central Cabell, west central Putnam and northwestern Wayne Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 601 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ceredo, or near Huntington, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Huntington, Ashland, Chesapeake, Proctorville, Barboursville, Kenova, Catlettsburg, Ceredo, Ona, South Point, Burlington, Crown City, Athalia, Lockwood, Lavalette, Scottown, Ashton, Pea Ridge and Green Bottom. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 188 and 191. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northeastern Kentucky...southeastern Ohio...and western West Virginia.
